intro: Capraea grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leafed rock cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or mountainous regions. Its leaves are lobed and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, while its small white or yellow flowers appear in clusters. Capraea grandifolia is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
